result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Unpaid Restitution - Civil Judgment - Reduced by any payment made since restitution order.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $91.82 converted to a civil judgment in favor of Mosier's Sporting Goods.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $9.18 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Any sentence currently being served.

Case called @ 2:35 p.m. Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court with authorization.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court orders: 30 days WC Jail concurrent to any sentence currently being served - Restitution in the amount of $91.82 converted to a civil judgment in favor of Mosier's Sporting Goods, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights mailed to DE.

Case Called @ 2:12 PM:  Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear.  Per ADA:  The Writ was superseded in another jurisdiction yesterday.  With multiple jurisdictions involved, Warrant requested.  SPD makes statement as to warrant.  The Court:  IA adjourned and requests that counsel obtain Atty Authorization to resolve via paperwork.  IA adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
